articles.title: “Ghostly” – Scientists Discover Mysterious Creature From the Shadows in Australia - SciTechDaily
articles.description: In the sun-baked Pilbara region of northwestern Australia, researchers have discovered a mysterious creature from the shadows – a new ant species of the elusive genus Leptanilla. The new species, Leptanilla voldemort – L. voldemort for short – is a pale ant w…
articles.content: In Australia’s Pilbara region, a new ant species, Leptanilla voldemort, has been discovered. It is characterized by its pale, slender form and underground habitat, shedding light on the unique biodiv… [+4732 chars]

articles.author: Ethan Siegel
articles.title: No, the expanding Universe doesn't break the speed of light - Big Think
articles.description: Yes, the Universe is expanding, but if you've ever wondered, "How fast is it expanding," the answer isn't in terms of a speed at all.

articles.author: Science X
articles.title: Digging up new species of Australia and New Guinea's giant fossil kangaroos - Phys.org
articles.description: Paleontologists from Flinders University have described three unusual new species of giant fossil kangaroo from Australia and New Guinea, finding them more diverse in shape, range and hopping method than previously thought.
articles.content: Paleontologists from Flinders University have described three unusual new species of giant fossil kangaroo from Australia and New Guinea, finding them more diverse in shape, range and hopping method … [+6733 chars]

articles.author: Jamie Carter
articles.title: One Of 2024’s Best Meteor Showers Has Begun: When To See The Eta Aquariids At Their Best - Forbes
articles.description: It’s worth trying to be somewhere dark for the peak night of the Eta Aquariids this year, which runs from April 15 through May 27, peaking on the night of May 4-5.
articles.content:
The Eta Aquariid meteor shower runs from April 15 through May 27, peaking on the night of May 4-5.
getty
The Eta Aquariids, slated to be one of the best meteor showers during 2024, have begun. The … [+2740 chars]

articles.description: When you throw dinosaurs into the mix, sometimes you find that a rule simply isn’t. A new study led by scientists at the University of Alaska Fairbanks and the University of Reading calls into question Bergmann’s rule, an 1800s-era scientific principle statin…

articles.author: Sharmila Kuthunur
articles.title: Gravitational waves reveal 1st-of-its-kind merger between neutron star and mystery object - Livescience.com
articles.description: Ripples in space-time point to the merger of a neutron star with another mystery object. The object, which falls right within the mass-gap range, sheds light on a long-sought, murky realm.
articles.content: Astronomers announced on April 5 that they may have detected a collision between a neutron star and a lightweight mystery object — an object larger than the largest known neutron star, but smaller th… [+3793 chars]

articles.author: Leman Altuntas, Leman Altuntaş
articles.title: 300 Year Old “Exceptional” Prosthesis made of Gold and Copper and wool Discovered in Poland - arkeonews
articles.description: A first-of-its-kind medical prosthesis: a nearly 300-year-old device that helped a man with cleft palate live more comfortably with this condition.
